narrative.title: 1St Moroccan March Division - 1943Q1
narrative.situation: French Colonial Infantry Division (Moroccan) deployed in North Africa during 1943Q1.
narrative.objectives: Defensive infantry division holding sectors of the Eastern Dorsal Mountains in central Tunisia
narrative.axis_objective: Hold current positions and prevent Allied breakthrough.
narrative.allied_objective: Advance and neutralize Axis defensive positions.

supply.supply_status: Stretched - Supply lines run from Algerian bases through British 1st Army logistics network. Severe spare parts shortages for pre-war French equipment.

weather.terrain: Mountainous - Eastern Dorsal Mountains of central Tunisia with rocky passes and wadis
environmental_challenges: Flash flooding in wadis during winter rains

air_support.note: No theater air summary available for this quarter

special_rules: North African troops well-adapted to desert conditions
Strong esprit de corps among Moroccan tirailleurs units

supply_states.supply_line_status: Stretched - Supply lines run from Algerian bases through British 1st Army logistics network. Severe spare parts shortages for pre-war French equipment.
